result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jorge Perez-Robles

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jorge Perez-Robles in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court for Jorge Perez-Robles.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant needs a spanish interpreter but none was assigned. Case adjourned to allow for Spanish interpreter to appear. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Jorge Perez-Robles not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court for Jorge Perez-Robles.  Attorney Navjot Hira in court for State of Wisconsin. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court, defendant Jorge Perez-Robles not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.  
Discussion held off the record. Defense counsel recently retained  and awaiting discovery from prior counsel.
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for substitution of counsel, received and forwarded to the Judge.
Received and Filed by Attorney Matthew Luening.
Received and Filed by Attorney Marc Christopher.

Adjustment Number: 22A 055602,
Payable Number: 1013112,
Receipt Number: 22RP023922,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jorge Perez-Robles in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Jorge Perez-Robles in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jorge Perez-Robles appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
